Request Storage Access Without direct file access permission, the app will need to copy SQLite files to its internal storage for each search, which may significantly slow down the process. However, the app will still function without this permission. With permission, SQLite files can be read directly from the phone\'s memory, allowing for instant database searches. The app does not have direct access to files
Select database type Grant Access No Permission Denied You can grant file access permission anytime in the app settings. Please note that you may need to remove and re-add database files here after granting permission.
Warning Direct access to the file is not available. The added database will be cached in the application for fast reading. This will take up an additional %1$.2f MB of phone memory. You can try granting direct file read permission and attempt to add the database again. Failed to obtain direct access to the file. Your firmware or Android version may not allow direct reading of SQLite files. The database will be cached in the application. Continue anyway Cancel
Clear Cached Databases The app has direct file access permission
Maximum number of points to send in one request. Default limit on all servers is 100, so it\'s recommended to keep it at 99. Delay between split requests in milliseconds. Welcome to WiFi Frankenstein Disclaimer By using this application, you agree to the following terms:\n\n• You will only use this application on your personal networks or with explicit permission from the network owner\n\n• This application is designed for checking personal network security and mapping free WiFi networks\n\n• The application does not contain a built-in database of networks and does not collect any personal data\n\n• The author takes no responsibility for any misuse of this application Choose Theme Choose Color Theme System Theme Skip Next Previous Checking for Updates Setup Completed Your app is now set up and ready to use! Cluster aggressiveness The level of aggressiveness for grouping points into clusters. Higher values create fewer clusters. Maximum cluster size Maximum number of points in one cluster. If a cluster has more points, it will be split. Minimum Aggressive points Zoom level: %1$d
Always Only when close
Marker visibility Indicates how close you need to zoom to the map to see markers. Low values allow you to see markers even when zoomed out.
Separate overlapping points Apply offset to points with identical coordinates

Custom type: Any SQLite database with an arbitrary structure, for which you can configure column mapping. Select 3WiFi type database Select custom database Skip Next

Required permissions The following permissions are required for the application to function correctly: Location access permission This permission is required to search for Wi-Fi networks and display them on the map. Without it, you will not be able to search for networks around you. File system access This permission is required to work with databases. Without it, database indexing will not be possible, and files will be cached inside the application, which will lead to double memory consumption. Request permission Permission granted Location icon Storage icon Permission status You can change these permissions later in your device settings. Location access Location access permission is required to search for Wi-Fi networks and display them on the map. Without this permission, you will not be able to search for networks around you. Without access to the location, the application will not be able to search for Wi-Fi networks around you and display them correctly on the map. Without access to the file system, the application will cache all databases inside the application, which will lead to double memory consumption and slow operation. Request again
Wi-Fi network saved Failed to save network Open Wi-Fi settings Copy the network name and password, then click the button below to open Wi-Fi settings Wi-Fi profile information Password: %s SSID: %s Network suggested to system Failed to suggest network to system Password This is an outdated version of the generator. It only creates PIN codes but cannot determine whether a generated code works. To find a potentially working PIN code, please use the new version of the generator.
About the application WIFI Frankenstein is an application for pintesting your wifi networks and working with wifi databases, displaying the location of wifi points on the map and much more. This is a Frankenstein application, which contains various functionality for working with wifi. The application was created to replace the old 3WiFi Locator application. Author: LowSkillDeveloper (Internet User in Telegram) Libraries used: Open on GitHub
AndroidX - Apache License 2.0 Material Components - Apache License 2.0 OpenCSV - Apache License 2.0 OkHttp - Apache License 2.0 osmdroid - Apache License 2.0 KotlinX Serialization - Apache License 2.0

PixieDust Attack PixieDust is a WPS attack that exploits weak randomness in some WPS implementations to recover the WPS PIN This attack only works on networks with WPS enabled and vulnerable implementations System Requirements Checking root access… Checking binary files… Network Scanning Scan for WPS Networks WPS Networks Attack Control No network selected Start Attack Stop Attack Attack Result Copy PIN Save Result WPS Scanning for networks… Preparing attack… Extracting handshake data… Running PixieDust attack… Attack completed Attack failed: %s Found %d WPS networks No WPS networks found Please select a network Root access required Binary files not found Root access: Not available PIN discovered: %s PIN not found Result saved successfully %s (%s) %d dBm %d MHz Warning This tool is for educational purposes only. Only use on networks you own or have explicit permission to test. Unauthorized access to wireless networks is illegal.
